Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on an unreliable website and does not provide any direct quotes or evidence from Denzel Washington himself.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Denzel Washington has announced his support for Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election, but there is no direct evidence or confirmation of this.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Denzel Washington had not formally endorsed any presidential candidate as of August 2016.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Denzel Washington has switched his support to Donald Trump, without any concrete evidence to support this.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists as the quote attributed to Denzel Washington in the claim was actually spoken by Charles Evers, the brother of Medgar Evers, and it was Evers who endorsed Trump, not Washington.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by providing misleading information and attributing quotes to Denzel Washington that were actually spoken by someone else.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
